Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2008 07:44PM SonCallsMeEarl wrote: I pop in on this site "daily"...since I was Dx last month and I have learned SO much. I've had "day 2" of radiation and it was a little better than day 1, but not much. I am a very emotional person so I cried as the machine went up and over me. I am going to be 50 yrs.old next week and my Mother passed away at the age of 50, she had liver cancer and two of her sisters died from breast cancer. So, needless to say I'm am doing my best to stay positive and strong. I have many supportive friends and a great church family, but I depend on "faith" and knowing that the Lord is carrying me through this. I truly wish you well, and hope that we can stay in touch via this "wonderful" site. God Bless!
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed with DCIS Jo_Ann_K SonCallsMeEarl

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2008 10:54PM SonCallsMeEarl wrote: Well Anne, I got on the phone and called the Doc. I will be going by his office tomorrow to pick up (what the pathology office called) a "ERPR"...whatever that is. I told the girl at the doc's office that all these women on the bc discussion board knew so much about their cancer, yet I knew absolutely nothing. (she was new and I think she was as lost as I was)  LOL  but said she would have someone get together what I needed. So you were diagnosed in 2007, yet you've been a member since 2002?  Why is that? ....if I'm not being nosey. I just love all you ladies  :)
Posts.Title: Pathology Report SonCallsMeEarl SonCallsMeEarl

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2008 10:37PM SonCallsMeEarl wrote: Hey TJ, I also started radiation today....it is sort of humiliating, not to mention I had a "new girl" in training that didn't make me feel much better. (even though I know we all have to start somewhere)   Well, the main guy (radiologist) was gay, which was nice, he was sensative and made me feel comfortable. It was quite an emotional experience, but like you I'm glad it's underway, back again tomorrow, but I have to do a total of 33 treatments....the journey begins.
